metadata.title: CVE-2016-5300 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
The XML parser in Expat does not use sufficient entropy for hashinitialization, which allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denialof service (CPU consumption) via crafted identifiers in an XML document.NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix forCVE-2012-0876.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5300` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.2.0-1
libexpat1 - 2.2.0-1
No subscription required

tla - 1.3.5+dfsg-15
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: expat package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.0-1').
xmlrpc-c package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and needs fixing.
tla package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.5+dfsg-15').
